name: Afghanistan
design: A vertical tricolor of black, red, and green charged in the center with the national emblem [0]

name: Albania
meaning: The red stands for bravery, strength and valor, while the double-headed eagle represents the sovereign state of Albania located in the Balkans.Â [0]
design: A silhouette of an open-winged bicephalated eagle on a red field. [0]

name: Algeria
history: The flag's design is derived from the standard of Emir Abdel Kadir in the 19th century which consisted of two equal vertical bands, green and white, as well as being inspired from the flag of the Algerian Regency from the 16th to the 19th century, which consisted of a white crescent and star on a red background (the same as the modern flag of Turkey; the Algerian Regency was an autonomous vassal of the Ottoman Empire). [0]
meaning: The white color represents peace; the green represents Islam; the red, the blood of those killed fighting for independence in the Algerian War (1954 to 1962) and the star and crescent represent Islam. [0]
design: A red star and crescent centered on a vertical bicolor of green and white. [0]

name: Andorra
design: A vertical tricolour of blue, yellow and red with the national coat of arms centred on the middle stripe. The middle stripe is one eighth thicker than the outer bands. [0]

name: Angola
meaning: The red is for the blood spilt by Angolans during their independence struggles, while the black is for the continent of Africa. The symbol in the middle is of a crossed cog wheel (representing workers and industry) and machete (representing the peasantry, agricultural production and the armed struggle) with a gold star. [0]
design: It is split horizontally into an upper red half and a lower black half, and features a yellow half-gear crossed with a machete and crowned with a star. [0]

name: Antigua and Barbuda
meaning: The rising sun symbolises the dawning of a new era. The colours have different meanings, the black is for the African ancestry of the people, the blue for hope, the red for energy or dynamism of the people. The successive colouring of yellow, blue, and white (from the sun down) also stands for the sun, sea, and sand. The blue also represents the Caribbean Sea, and the V-shape is the symbol of victory. [0]
design: The design of the National Flag is a red field with an inverted isosceles triangle based on the top edge of the field; the triangle contains a horizontal tricolor of black, light blue and white with a rising sun centered on top of the black band. [0]

name: Argentina
design: A horizontal triband of light blue (top and bottom) and white with the yellow Sun of May charged in the center. [0]

name: Armenia
meaning: The red emblematizes the Armenian Highland, the Armenian people's continued struggle for survival, maintenance of the Christian faith, Armenia's independence and freedom. The blue emblematizes the will of the people of Armenia to live beneath peaceful skies. The orange emblematizes the creative talent and hard-working nature of the people of Armenia. [0]
design: A horizontal tricolour of red, blue, and orange [0]

name: Australia
design: A Blue Ensign defaced with the Commonwealth Star (also known as the Federation Star) in the lower hoist quarter and the five stars of the Southern Cross in the fly half. [0]

name: Austria
design: A horizontal bicolour triband of red (top and bottom) and white. [0]

name: Azerbaijan
meaning: The blue symbolises Azerbaijan's Turkic heritage, the red stands for progress, and the green represents Islam. [0]
design: A horizontal tricolor of blue, red, and green, with a white crescent and an eight-pointed star centered on a red band [0]
